docs.lead_paragraph: This third feature from Stéphane Lafleur follows a woman who takes what she wants on the job at a secondhand store and generally lives an impulsive life.

docs.lead_paragraph: Updated | 10:10 a.m. On Monday night in San Francisco an information technology consultant named Austin Heap reported on his blog that the official Web site of Iran's president, Ahmadinejad.ir, had been attacked by hackers.
docs.abstract: An information technology consultant in San Francisco writes that "someone seems to have had their way with Ahmadinejad's web servers."
docs.snippet: An information technology consultant in San Francisco writes that "someone seems to have had their way with Ahmadinejad's web servers."...

docs.lead_paragraph: Rebecca Joy Moss, the daughter of Adena K. Moss and Edward R. Moss of Rockville Centre, N.Y., was married last evening to Dr. Andrew Phillip Schwartz, a son of Sandra J. Schwartz and Dr. Irwin L. Schwartz of Setauket, N.Y. Cantor Moshe Weiss officiated at Temple Beth Sholom in Roslyn Heights, N.Y. Mrs. Schwartz, 28, graduated cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania and received a master's degree in clinical psychology from the University of Illinois, where she is now a Ph.D. candidate in the same field. In July, she is to begin an internship in clinical psychology at New York-Presbyterian Hospital. Her father is an associate at Fine, Olin & Anderman, a law firm in Garden City, N.Y. Her mother teaches first grade at the Brandeis School in Lawrence, N.Y.

docs.lead_paragraph: Which city will be the next hotbed, beyond Silicon Valley, for educating data analysts of the future?
docs.abstract: East Coast/West Coast rivalry has made its way to universities preparing next generation of data scientists; New York and Seattle are already sparring over which will be the next hotbed, beyond Silicon Valley, for educating these analysts of the future.

docs.abstract: Yesterday we took the occasion of our multibillionaire mayor's 70th birthday to ask readers if they would be interested in having his money if they had to suddenly fast-forward to his age to get it.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a story July 6 about Wal-Mart's payment service, The Associated Press reported erroneously that a cashier scans a QR code on the phone when a customer uses Wal-Mart Pay. In fact, the customer scans a QR code that's displayed at the register.
